intro: Hieracium semicrispum, commonly known as the semi-crisp hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it can reach heights of up to 60 centimeters. Its leaves are usually alternate, with a rough or hairy texture, and its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium semicrispum is often considered a weed due to its aggressive growth and ability to spread rapidly.
